edu.berkeley.cs.jqf.instrument.tracing

Class ThreadTracer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • edu.berkeley.cs.jqf.instrument.tracing.ThreadTracer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class ThreadTracer
extends Thread
    This class is responsible for tracing for an instruction stream generated by a single thread in the application.

    Each ThreadTracer instance is a shadow thread for one application thread.

    A ThreadTracer instance holds an instruction queue that is populated by the application thread via SingleSnoop, and removes items from it to generate TraceEvents. The generated events are handled by a callback that is registered via SingleSnoop.setCallbackGenerator(Function).

    Author:
    Rohan Padhye

      • ThreadTracer

        protected ThreadTracer(Thread tracee,
                       String entryPoint,
                       Consumer<TraceEvent> callback)
        Creates a new tracer that will process instructions executed by an application thread.
        Parameters:
        tracee - the thread to trace
        entryPoint - the outermost method call to trace (formatted as fq-class#method)
        callback - the callback to invoke whenever a trace event is emitted

      • next

        protected final Instruction next()
                          throws InterruptedException
        Retrieves the next yet-unprocessed instruction in FIFO sequeuence.

        This method blocks for the next instruction up to a fixed timeout. After the timeout, it checks to see if the tracee is alive and if so repeats the timed-block. If the tracee is dead, the tracer is interrupted.

        Returns:
        the next yet-unprocessed instruction in FIFO sequeuence
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the tracee appears to be dead

      • restore

        protected final void restore(Instruction ins)
        Returns an instruction to the queue for processing.

        This is useful for performing a lookahead in the instruction stream.

        Parameters:
        ins - the instruction to restore to the queue

        public void run()
